means: Never on Sunday 别在星期天，决不在星期天

sentence.Network_en: Failure is never quite so frightening as regret do.
sentence.Network_cn: 比失败更令人恐惧的是懊悔。

sentence.Network_en: "One thing you can never insure against is corruption among your staff."—"Agreed."
sentence.Network_cn: “永远也防不胜防的就是员工内部的贪污腐败。”——“同意。”

sentence.Network_en: The public never had faith in his ability to handle the job.
sentence.Network_cn: 公众从来不相信他有能力胜任这一职位。

phrase.cizu_name: well I never! (或 I never did!)

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)我真没想到（或见到、听到）过

lj.lj_ly: Well I never—that's not like you!.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English nǣfre, from ne 'not' + ǣfre 'ever'

encyclopedia.content: 歌曲介绍 歌手：mario 所属专辑：《Mario》 发行时间：2009-08-10 所属公司：SONY&BMG歌词 Girl u wanna know what's up I can truly say that I love u And we know that love is not puffed up So there are things in love that you'll never do I would never jump off a building and survive And if that building were burning I would never leave you inside I would probably never live to see a hundred years ol

entry.def: Never means at no time in the past or at no time in the future.

example.ex: I have never lost the weight I put on in my teens...
example.tran: 我十几岁时增加的体重一直没有减下去。

example.ex: Never had he been so free of worry...
example.tran: 他从未如此无忧无虑过。

entry.def: Never means 'not in any circumstances at all'.

example.ex: I would never do anything to hurt him...
example.tran: 我决不会做任何伤害他的事情。

example.ex: Even if you are desperate to get married, never let it show...
example.tran: 即使你想结婚想得发狂，也决不要表现出来。

entry.tran: 永不，永无，从未(never的强调说法)
entry.def: Never ever is an emphatic way of saying 'never'.

example.ex: I never, ever sit around thinking, 'What shall I do next?'...
example.tran: 我从不闲坐着琢磨：“我接下来做什么呢？”

example.ex: He's vowed never ever to talk about anything personal in public, ever again.
example.tran: 他已发誓再也不当众谈论任何个人的事情，永远不。

entry.def: Never is used to refer to the past and means 'not'.

example.tran: 他从没有取得任何成就。

example.ex: He waited until all the luggage was cleared, but Paula's never appeared...
example.tran: 他一直等到所有的行李都拿走了，但始终没看见葆拉的。

entry.def: You say 'never!' to indicate how surprised or shocked you are by something that someone has just said.

entry.tran: (表示惊讶)我真没看到(或发现、想到)过
entry.def: You say 'Well, I never' to indicate that you are very surprised about something that you have just seen or found out.

example.ex: 'What were you up to there?' — 'I was head of the information department.' — 'Well I never!'
example.tran: “你在那儿干什么？”——“我是信息部的负责人。”——“啊，真没想到!”

entry.tran: (经常为幽默地表示)不好，不行，不合适
entry.def: If you say that something will never do or would never do, you are saying, often humorously, that you think it is not appropriate or not suitable in some way.

example.ex: It would never do to have Henry there in her apartment...
example.tran: 亨利呆在她的公寓里怎么也不合适。

example.ex: I don't think it is an example of bad writing myself, otherwise I'd be agreeing with Leavis, and that would never do.
example.tran: 我本人不认为这是篇糟糕的文章，否则我就和利维斯看法一样了，那可不行。

means.word_mean: 1. not ever; at no time in the past or future;
2. not at all; certainly not; not in any circumstances;

sentences.sentence: "what is morally wrong can never be politically right"

auth_sentence.content: Bolan himself was never one to avoid a trend.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bolan himself was never one to avoid a trend.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bolan himself was never one to avoid a trend.

auth_sentence.content: Several species being replaced by one is never good.
auth_sentence.res_content: Several species being replaced by one is never good.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Several species being replaced by one is never good.

auth_sentence.content: He would never have had it any other way.
auth_sentence.res_content: He would never have had it any other way.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He would never have had it any other way.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 其变体n用在元音前面,表示"不,非"

stems_affixes.word_buile: ne不,非+utral→adj.中立的;中性的,中和的
ne不,非+either[两者]任一的→neither[两者]都不
ne不,非+ever曾经, 永远→永远都不→决不
never决不+the+less无……→具有转折之意:没有决不→然而
ne不,非+either[两者]任一的→neither[两者]都不
never决不+the+less无……→具有转折之意:没有决不→然而

Sentence.sentence: If you think so, you're not alone, because energy independence has been the dream of American president for decades, and never more so than in the past few years, when the most recent oil price shock has been partly responsible for kicking off the great recession.
She never bought clothes and always wore the same long, ragged black skirt.
But a man named Al Herpin turned out to be a real exception, for supposedly, he never slept

means.word_mean: 从不, 永不, 从来没有

sentences.en: I can never understand why Mary said nothing about her wrongs.
sentences.cn: 我毫不理解玛丽说她什么也没有做错。

sentences.en: Neighbours are said never to agree.
sentences.cn: 据说, 邻居们永远不会同意。

sentences.en: He never intended to use this method.
sentences.cn: 他从来没想使用这种方法。

sentences.en: Never having seen him before, I did not know what he looked like.
sentences.cn: 我从来没见过他, 不知道他长得怎样。

sentences.en: I hope never to see him again.
Never have I seen such a strange person.
sentences.cn: 我从来没见过这样的怪人。

sentences.en: There is never a friend but he remembers the birthday of.
sentences.cn: 他记得每个朋友的生日。

sentences.en: I have never been abroad, neither[nor] have I ever wished to go.
sentences.cn: 我从未去过国外, 我也从未想去。

sentences.en: He never behaves honestly, nor wisely.
sentences.cn: 他的行为既不诚实, 也不聪明。

sentences.en: You can tell him now, remember better late than never.
sentences.cn: 你现在可以告诉他, 要记得“晚做总比不做好”。

jushi.english: Neighbors are said never to agree.
jushi.chinese: 据说,邻居们永远不会同意。

jushi.english: I have never been abroad, neither〔nor〕 have I ever wished to go.
jushi.chinese: 我从未去过国外,我也从未想去。
